text: View of the Crocker Building in San Francisco (1912) Ad Shoreline oil wells in Summerland, California (1902) Aerial view gelatin silver print of Oakland from 1,000 feet Raper James Waters (born 1856) was an American photographer in California and Nevada. In 1892, Waters opened a commercial photography studio in San Francisco. Photographs by Waters are held at the J. Paul Getty Museum, the Metropolitan Museum of Art,https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/259580 the Library of Congress, the Online Archive of California, and the University of Nevada, Reno library. The Library of Congress has two of his panoramic photographs from 1909, three years after the 1906 San Francisco Earthquake. == References == Category:20th-century American photographers Category:1856 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Photographers from Nevada Category:19th-century American photographers Category:Photographers from San Francisco
title: R. J. Waters
